name: abjuration
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a formal or public statement that you no longer agree with a belief or way of behaving: She was forced to make an abjuration of her Catholic faith. Her abjuration of her belief in independence for the country came as a major shock.
More examplesFewer examplesFollowing his abjuration of his dissolute past, he was accepted back into the Church. Galileo was forced into an abjuration of his belief that the Earth orbits the Sun.One of the duties of a coroner in the Middle Ages was to accept the abjurations of those seeking sanctuary.
